content.description:
A balanced chemical equation is shown, and values of <math alttext="delta H naught sub f" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <msubsup> <mi>H</mi> <mi>f</mi> <mo>∘</mo> </msubsup> </math> are provided in the table.

<math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H, liquid, plus 3 O 2, gas, react to produce 2 C O 2, gas, plus 3 H 2 O, liquid" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mtext>C</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mtext>OH</mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>l</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>→</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi>CO</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>l</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>

<math alttext="delta H naught equals negative 1368 kilojoules per mole of reaction" overflow="scroll"> <mo> </mo> <mo> </mo> <mtext>Δ</mtext> <msup> <mi>H</mi> <mo>∘</mo> </msup> <mo>=</mo> <mo>-</mo> <mn>1368</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mtext>kJ/mol</mtext> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </msub> </math>

content.question: Based on the reaction and data table shown, what is the value of <math alttext="delta H naught sub f" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><msubsup><mi>H</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>∘</mo></msubsup></math> of <math alttext="C 2 H 5 O H, liquid" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mtext>C</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>H</mtext> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mtext>OH</mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>l</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
